alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 6:34AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Locally Heavy Rainfall and Melting Snow May Cause Ponding on Area Roadways.... Locally heavy rainfall along with snow accumulations have occured across the eastern portions of Cuyahoga County eastward into Lake, Geauga and Trumbull Counties. Area creeks have seen rises and may be bankfull in several locations. Also of concern are the locations that got a slushy accumulation of snow. This heavy wet snow has brought down several trees and power lines across portions of Lake, Geauga and Trumbull Counties. If you encounter downed power lines please stay away from them. Locations that did get snow may experience blocked drains from the snow and fallen leaves. This could lead to some localized flooding as the snow melts and additional rainfall moves over the area through mid morning. Motorists need to be prepared for ponding of water on area roadways. Slow down to avoid hydroplaning. If flooding is observed please report it to the National Weather Service in Cleveland through social media. On twitter @NWSCLE, and on facebook using US National Weather Service Cleveland.

area.areaDesc: Ashtabula Inland; Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit; Trumbull
